Author: Author
Target: Various government organizations since 2021, including Lithuania, India, Vatican, and Slovakia.
Description: Researchers from Sentinel One discover a new campaign by the pro-Russian group Winter Vivern, targeting several European government organizations and telecommunication service providers to conduct espionage.
Australian financial services company Latitude Financial Services reveals that personal information of approximately 14 million individuals might have been compromised in a data breach.
In the wake of the Latitude Financial Services breach, the threat actor is able to steal an employee's login and use it for logging into two of the company's service providers to steal customer data.

Author: BianLian
Description: Researchers from Redacted reveal that the BianLian ransomware group has shifted its focus from encrypting its victims' files to only exfiltrating data found on compromised networks and using them for extortion.

Author: HinataBot
Target: Realtek SDK, Huawei routers, and Hadoop YARN servers
Description: Researchers from Akamai discover HinataBot, a new malware botnet targeting Realtek SDK, Huawei routers, and Hadoop YARN servers to recruit devices into DDoS.
Attack: Multiple vulnerabilities including CVE-2014-8361 and CVE-2017-17215

Author: UNC3886
Target: Defense, government, tech, and telecom organizations
Description: Researchers from Mandiant reveal that the suspected Chinese threat actor UNC3886 has been exploiting the Fortinet CVE-2022-41328 vulnerability to target organizations in the in the defense, government, tech, and telecom sectors.

Author: Trigona
Target: At least 16 organizations in the manufacturing, finance, construction, agriculture, marketing and high technology industries.
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover Trigona, a new ransomware strain extremely active in Australia, Italy, France, Germany, New Zealand, and the United States.
Country: AU DE FR IT NZ US

Description: Researchers from Armorblox detect a new hybrid phishing campaign impersonating the Social Security Administration (SSA), which tries to trick recipients into calling a criminal call center.

Researchers from ESET discover dozens of copycat Telegram and WhatsApp websites targeting mainly Android and Windows users with trojanized versions of these instant messaging apps hiding clipper malware.
Happy State Bank (HSB) files a notice of data breach after learning that confidential consumer information stored on the company’s computer system was compromised following an email phishing attack.

Author: Phoenix
Description: A pro-Russian hacker group, Phoenix, claims to have hacked the Indian Health Ministry, and stolen sensitive information on hospitals, staff, patients and more.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: Hitachi Energy confirms it suffered a data breach after the Clop ransomware gang stole data using the GoAnywhere zero-day vulnerability.

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: Rio Tinto, the world's second-largest metals and mining corporation, ia added to Clop’s ransomware list of victims.

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: Investissement Québec, a government organization created to attract businesses to the region, confirms that one of its suppliers was attacked through the GoAnywhere MFT product by the Clop ransomware gang.
The NBA (National Basketball Association) notifies fans of a data breach after some of their personal information, "held" by a third-party newsletter service, was stolen.

The largest provider of mobile, television, internet and telephone services to the U.S. territories of Guam and the Northern Mariana Islands, Docomo Pacific, recovers from a cyberattack that brought down many of its services.

Author: ShellBot (AKA PerlBot)
Description: Researchers from AhnLab discover a new variant of the ShellBot malware employed in a campaign that targets poorly managed Linux SSH servers.
Security firm BlockSec prevents a hacker from stealing $5 million from the NFT lending project Paraspace.

Sunland Asphalt and Construction files a notice of data breach after learning that an unknown actor had gained access to certain parts of the Sunland network that stored confidential consumer information.
The Health Plan of San Mateo files a notice of data breach after learning that an unauthorized party was able to access confidential member information stored in an employee’s email account.
Associates in Dermatology (AID) files a notice of data breach after a ransomware attack targeting its vendor Virtual Private Network Solutions (VPN Solutions),
El Camino Health investigates claims of a possible data breach.

Target: Cooperativa de Electricidad Obras y Servicios Públicos de San Antonio de Areco (CEOSP)
Description: The Cooperativa de Electricidad Obras y Servicios Públicos de San Antonio de Areco (CEOSP) posts a notice about a malware incident:

Author: Ursnif
Description: The Italian taxpayers are the targets of a campaign distributing the Ursnif malware via fake notifications from the Italian Revenue Agency (Agenzia delle Entrate).

Leading Bitcoin ATM maker General Bytes discloses that hackers stole cryptocurrency from the company and its customers using a zero-day vulnerability in its BATM management platform. $1.5M worth are stolen.
The CHC Montlégia in Liège is still down for a cyber attack suffered in November 2022.

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: The Italian Zucchetti Kos, a manufacturer of sanitary taps, is hit by the Clop ransomware gang.

Author: Vice Society
Target: Puerto Rico Aqueduct and Sewer Authority (PRASA)
Description: The Vice Society ransomware gang claims to have hit the Puerto Rico Aqueduct and Sewer Authority (PRASA)
QIMR Berghofer, an Australian medical research institute, is hit by a data breach after Datatime, a technology company hired by QIMR, suffers a cyber attack.

Author: NoName057(16)
Target: High Council of the Judiciary (Consiglio Superiore della Magistratura)
Description: The High Council of the Judiciary is taken down by a DDoS attack launched by the hacktivists of the pro-Russian NoName057(16) collective.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from JFrog discover a sophisticated and highly-malicious attack targeting .NET developers via the NuGet repository, using sophisticated typosquatting techniques downloaded more than 150,000 times.
Ferrari discloses a data breach following a ransom demand received after attackers gained access to some of the company's IT systems.

Author: Kimsuky (aka Thallium, Velvet Chollima)
Description: A joint cybersecurity advisory from the German Federal Office for the Protection of the Constitution (BfV) and the National Intelligence Service of the Republic of Korea (NIS) warns about Kimsuky's use of Chrome extensions to steal target's Gmail emails.
The Lansing Community College brings systems back online after experiencing a cyberattack that cut off campus Wi-Fi and forced the school to temporarily cancel its online courses.

Author: REF2924
Target: Organizations in southern and southeast Asia
Description: Researchers from Elastic discover Naplistener, a novel data-stealing malware with high capabilities to evade detection.

Author: Chinese Military
Description: Australian airline Qantas issues standing orders to its pilots advising them that some of its fleet experienced interference on VHF stations from sources purporting to be the Chinese Military.

Author: Mispadu
Target: Banking users Chile, Mexico, Peru and Portugal
Description: Researchers from Metabase Q discover twenty different spam campaigns relying on the Mispadu banking Trojan were discovered targeting victims in Chile, Mexico, Peru and Portugal.

The Twitter account of one of the leading news channels in India – News24 – is the victim of a cryptocurrency scheme, with attackers breaching their security to post phishing links of a fake XRP drop.
Oklahoma City University (OCU) files a notice of data breach after learning that a cyberattack compromised the security of current and former students and employees,
A ransomware attack forces the majority of Shoreline Community College students and staff to transition to remote work.

Target: Consejo Nacional de Supervisión del Sistema Financiero (CONASSIF)
Description: The website of the Costa Rican Consejo Nacional de Supervisión del Sistema Financiero (CONASSIF) is defaced.

Author: pro-Russia Threat Actors
Description: M7 Group’s Czech and Slovak operator Skylink is the victim of a DDoS attack by Russian threat actors.

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: The Clop ransomware gang claims to have attacked Saks Fifth Avenue on its dark web leak site.

Author: Bad Magic (State-sponsored threat actor)
Target: Government, agriculture and transportation organizations located in the Donetsk, Lugansk, and Crimea regions
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky discover a campaign targeting government, agriculture and transportation organizations located in the Donetsk, Lugansk, and Crimea regions via a previously unseen malicious framework called CommonMagic and a new backdoor called PowerMagic.

Researchers from Sucuri discover a new credit card stealing campaign hiding the malicious code inside the 'Authorize.net' payment gateway module for WooCommcerce, to evade detection by security scans.
Google suspends the Chinese shopping app Pinduoduo on its app store after malware was discovered in versions of the app from other sources.

Author: Nexus
Description: Researchers from Cleafy discover Nexus, and Android malware able to perform account takeover (ATO) attacks against more than 450 financial applications.
Researchers from Group-IB discover a campaign leveraging more than 2400 scam pages targeting Arabic-speaking job seekers in 13 countries

Author: APT37 (AKA ScarCruft or Temp.Reaper)
Target: Individuals in various South Korean organizations
Description: Researchers from Zscaler discover a new campaign by the North Korean APT27 threat actor, using weaponized Microsoft Compiled HTML Help (CHM) files to download additional malware onto targeted machines.

Author: SideCopy APT
Target: India's Defense Research and Development Organization (DRDO)
Description: Security researchers from Cyble discover a new campaign by the Pakistani cyberespionage group SideCopy APT employing fresh tactics to target workers at India's Defense Research and Development Organization and steal sensitive military secrets.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Target: Top of the World Ranch Treatment Center
Description: Top of the World Ranch Treatment Center discloses a healthcare data breach that stemmed from unauthorized access to one business email account.

Researchers from Guardio Labs discover a trojanized version of the legitimate ChatGPT extension for Chrome, called FakeGPT, gaining popularity on the Chrome Web Store, accumulating over 9,000 downloads while stealing Facebook accounts.

Researchers from Phylum discover 'onyxproxy', a malicious package on PyPI uses Unicode as an obfuscation technique to evade detection while stealing and exfiltrating developers' account credentials and other sensitive data from compromised devices.
InQuest Labs analysts detect a phishing attack discovered by a municipal government organization, hosting the phishing pages on Raven and Microsoft Azure.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: Payment software startup AvidXchange joins the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware attack carried out exploiting the CVE-2023-0669 Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability,

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: Swiss pharmaceutical giant Galderma joins the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware attack carried out exploiting the CVE-2023-0669 Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability,

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: Healthcare call center provider ITx Companies joins the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware attack carried out exploiting the CVE-2023-0669 Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability,

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: Child mental health startup Brightline joins the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware attack carried out exploiting the CVE-2023-0669 Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability,

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: Events planner Emerald Expositions joins the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware attack carried out exploiting the CVE-2023-0669 Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability,

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: MedMinder joins the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware attack carried out exploiting the CVE-2023-0669 Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability,

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: Private equity firm Onex joins the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware attack carried out exploiting the CVE-2023-0669 Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability,

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: Rehab and mental health provider Homewood Health joins the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware attack carried out exploiting the CVE-2023-0669 Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability,

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: England-based affordable housing provider Guinness Partnership joins the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware attack carried out exploiting the CVE-2023-0669 Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability,

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: Retail banking company Avidia Bank joins the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware attack carried out exploiting the CVE-2023-0669 Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability,

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: Medex Healthcare joins the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware attack carried out exploiting the CVE-2023-0669 Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability,

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: Cornerstone Home Lending joins the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware attack carried out exploiting the CVE-2023-0669 Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability,

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: Colombian energy giant Grupo Vanti joins the list of the victims of the Clop ransomware attack carried out exploiting the CVE-2023-0669 Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability,
Researchers from Abnormal Security reveal the details of an attempted $36M Business Email Compromise attack against an insurance firm.
Alliance Healthcare, the fourth largest pharmaceutical distributor in Spain, is hit with a cyber attack.

Author: Kritec
Description: Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a web skimming campaign carried out through a new skimmer dubbed Kritec, targeting Magento stores and abusing Google Tag Manager.

Author: AiD Lock aka DarkBLUP
Description: Researchers from Intel471 discover AresLoader, a new loader malware-as-a-service (MaaS) offered by threat actors with links to Russian hacktivism, offering a “binder” tool that allows users to masquerade their malware as legitimate software.
US Wellness files a notice of data breach after learning that a data security incident at one of the company’s vendors compromised certain customers’ protected health information.

Author: NoName057(16)
Target: Italian Ministry of Infrastructure and Transport
Description: The Italian Ministry of Infrastructure and Transport is taken down by a DDoS attack launched by the pro-Russian hacktivists of the NoName057(16) collective.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: The City of Toronto appears among Clop ransomware gang's latest victims hit in the ongoing GoAnywhere hacking spree.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: Virgin Red, the Virgin Rewards program, appears among Clop ransomware gang's latest victims hit in the ongoing GoAnywhere hacking spree.

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: The UK’s Pension Protection Fund (PPF) appears among Clop ransomware gang's latest victims hit in the ongoing GoAnywhere hacking spree.

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: Munich Re, the German insurance company, appears among Clop ransomware gang's latest victims hit in the ongoing GoAnywhere hacking spree.

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: Procter & Gamble (P&G) appears among Clop ransomware gang's latest victims hit in the ongoing GoAnywhere hacking spree.

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: Mexican airline Volaris appears among Clop ransomware gang's latest victims hit in the ongoing GoAnywhere hacking spree.

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: US-based TV network Gray Television appears among Clop ransomware gang's latest victims hit in the ongoing GoAnywhere hacking spree.

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: Pluralsight appears among Clop ransomware gang's latest victims hit in the ongoing GoAnywhere hacking spree.

Author: BlackGuard stealer
Description: Researchers from AT&T Alien Labs discover a new variant of the BlackGuard stealer, featuring new capabilities like USB propagation, persistence mechanisms, loading additional payloads in memory, and targeting additional crypto wallets.

Author: Emotet
Description: Researchers from Malwarebytes and Palo Alto Networks discover a new Emotet phishing campaign targeting U.S. taxpayers by impersonating W-9 tax forms allegedly sent by the Internal Revenue Service and partner companies.

Target: At least 1600 individuals across Europe, the US and other countries
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky discover a novel phishing scam relying on legitimate servers from Microsoft’s collaborative platform SharePoint, targeting at least 1600 individuals across Europe, the US and other countries using a native notification mechanism.
The city of Oak Ridge in Tennessee reveals that city officials are working with law enforcement and cybersecurity experts to deal with a ransomware attack affecting its technology systems.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The Walsall Healthcare NHS Trust, which runs Walsall Manor Hospital, discloses that it has been impacted by a “contained” cyber incident.
Wisconsin Court System is hit with a DDoS attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Chinese threat actors (linked to APT41 and Gallium?)
Target: Telecommunication providers in the Middle East
Description: Researchers from Sentinel One reveal the details of 'Operation Tainted Love', an operation carried out by a Chinese threat actor linked to APT41 and Gallium, targeting telecommunication providers in the Middle East
Attackers steal the personal data of about one million of users from kids’ tech coding camp iD Tech.

Target: At least 1600 individuals across Europe, the US and other countries
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky discover a novel phishing scam relying on legitimate servers from Microsoft’s collaborative platform SharePoint, targeting at least 1600 individuals across Europe, the US and other countries using a native notification mechanism.
Researchers from Palo Alto Networks reveal the details of an ongoing widespread malicious JavaScript (JS) injection campaign that redirects victims to malicious content such as adware and scam pages.

Target: Instagram users from various countries including the UK, Australia, France, Spain, and Poland
Description: Researchers from Avast discover a new scam, using fake SHEIN gift cards as lure, and targeting Instagram users from various countries including the UK, Australia, France, Spain, and Poland.

Author: Cinoshi
Description: Researchers from Cyble discover a new Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) platform called “Cinoshi”, consisting of a stealer, botnet, clipper, and cryptominer.

Author: NoName057(16)
Description: The pro-Russian collective takes down the website of the Italian Constitutional Court.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Bitter APT
Target: Various Chinese nuclear energy companies and academics related to that field.
Description: Researchers from Intezer disclose a cyber espionage campaign carried out by the group tracked as 'Bitter APT' targeting the Chinese nuclear energy industry using phishing emails to infect devices with malware downloaders.
The Federal Bureau of Investigation warns companies in the U.S. of threat actors using tactics similar to business email to steal various goods from vendors.

Researchers from Uptycs discover a new info-stealing malware named MacStealer, targeting Mac users, stealing their credentials stored in the iCloud KeyChain and web browsers, cryptocurrency wallets, and potentially sensitive files.

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: The Clop ransomware gang adds the government of Tasmania to its list of organizations breached via the CVE-2023-0669 Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability,
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The University of New Orleans restores its network after the Louisiana State Police said it found evidence that their systems had been compromised.
The LSU Agricultural Center restores its network after the Louisiana State Police said it found evidence that their systems had been compromised.
The Nunez Community College restores its network after the Louisiana State Police said it found evidence that their systems had been compromised.
The River Parishes Community College restores its network after the Louisiana State Police said it found evidence that their systems had been compromised.
The Southern University at Shreveport restores its network after the Louisiana State Police said it found evidence that their systems had been compromised.
Nearly half a million people have their sensitive financial information leaked during a cyberattack on NCB Management Services – a company that purchases debt.

Author: Two men and two women
Description: The Australian Federal Police (AFP) arrests four members of a cybercriminal syndicate that has laundered $1.7 million stolen from at least 15 victims between January 2020 and March 2023.

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: The French IT company ATOS confirms that Nimbix, a subsidiary, suffered a Clop ransomware attack occurred exploiting the CVE-2023-0669 Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability.
American Pain and Wellness files a notice of data breach after learning that an unauthorized party was able to access confidential patient data stored on the company’s computer network.
Tri Counties Bank posts a “Network Outage Update” after determining that a recent ransomware attack may have resulted in confidential consumer data being exposed to hackers.
Frideres Dental confirms that the protected health information of 1,596 patients was potentially compromised in a cyberattack.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: Fabrega Molino is Panamanian law firm is reportedly hacked by the BlackCat ransomware gang, which claims to have 113GB of files.

Author: Medusa
Description: Vazquez Nava Consultores y Abogados, a Mexican firm of consultants and lawyers, is added to the Medusa ransomware leak site.
Some United States Postal Service workers in the eastern North Carolina and Jacksonville area lose their paychecks due to a cyber attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The Australian pension fund NGS Super confirms a cyberattack that occurred earlier this month, in which "some limited data" was stolen
A hacker tries to unsuccessfully drain funds from Swerve Finance for more than a week.

Author: RansomHouse
Description: The Italian Municipality of Taggia is hit by the RansomHouse ransomware gang.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: A new campaign delivering the Mekotio malware using the company Leonardo as a bait, hits victims in Italy.
The University of the People (UoPeople) files a notice of data breach after learning that an unauthorized party was able to access confidential information stored on the school’s SharePoint platform.

Author: Dark Power
Description: A new ransomware operation named 'Dark Power' appears, and it has already listed its first victims on a dark web data leak site, threatening to publish the data if a ransom is not paid.
Attacker manage  to steal $500,000 worth of tokens from layer-2 scaling solution Arbitrum’s March 23 airdrop

Author: RansomHouse
Description: The Italian manufacturing Cospec is hit with a RansomHouse ransomware attack.

Author: NoName057(16)
Description: A new wave of DDoS attacks by the NoName057(16) collective hits several websites in Italy including the Constitutional Court, and the National Authority of Transports.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: Sun Pharmaceuticals, the largest pharmaceutical company in India confirms a ransomware attack in its regulatory filings, explaining that the incident involved the theft of company data and personal information.
The Yucatan Government is hit by a cyber attack affecting multiple services.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: NoName057(16)
Target: ATAC (Azienda Tramvie e Autobus del Comune di Roma)
Description: ATAC, the company managing the public transportation of the city of Rome, is hit by a DDoS attack launched by the pro-Russian NoName057(16) collective.
Several vending machines distributing cigarettes in Italy are hijacked in support of Alfredo Cospito, an Italian anarchist in jail under the the 41-bis hard prison regime.
Researchers from Proofpoint discover a new IcedID campaign using HTML Smuggling to drop a password protected, zipped Windows Script File (WSF).
Researchers from Proofpoint discover a new IcedID campaign using invoice-themed email lures to deliver IcedID via Microsoft OneNote attachments.

Researchers from Proofpoint discover a new IcedID campaign using two different email lures: a recall notice from the National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act; and a violation from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to deliver the IcedID malware.

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)
Description: Crown Resorts, Australia's largest gambling and entertainment company, confirms that it suffered a ransomware attack after its GoAnywhere secure file-sharing server was breached using the CVE-2023-0669 zero-day vulnerability.
Lumen Technologies tells regulators that it had discovered two cybersecurity incidents, including a ransomware attack that has been degrading services for some enterprise customers.

Author: Ransom House
Description: The Tanbridge House School is listed in the Ransom House ransomware gang leak site.

Author: NullMixer
Description: A recent NullMixer campaign hits targets in Italy, France and North America.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky discover a surge of phishing campaigns carried out exploiting the distributed Interplanetary File System (IPFS).

Author: DBatLoader
Description: Researchers from Zscaler discover a new DBatLoader campaign distributing the Remcos RAT and Formbook malware.

Bright Horizons Family Solutions files a notice of data breach after learning that an unauthorized actor logged on to the company’s corporate system and stole files containing confidential employee information.

Author: Clop (AKA Cl0p)?
Description: Blue Shield of California files a notice of data breach after learning that one of the company’s vendors, Fortra, was the target of a cyberattack.

Author: Six members of a criminal gang
Description: Indian police arrests six members of an alleged criminal gang that sold the personal data of 168 million Indian citizens, including defense personnel and government employees.

Nonstop Administration and Insurance Services (NAIS) announces that the protected health information of employees of its clients has been exposed to an unknown party, who claimed to have accessed company data.

Author: APT43 (AKA  Kimsuky, Thallium)
Target: Government organizations, academics, and think tanks in the United States, Europe, Japan, and South Korea for the past five years.
Description: Researchers from Mandiant disclose the details of APT43, a new North Korean group, financially motivated and engaged in cyber espionage operations, targeting government organizations, academics, and think tanks in the United States, Europe, Japan, and South Korea for the past five years.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Target: Tor users in Russia and Eastern Europe
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky discover a surge of trojanized Tor Browser installers targeting Russians and Eastern Europeans with clipboard-hijacking malware that steals infected users' cryptocurrency transactions.
AudienceView, an online ticketing platform, discloses to have been hit by a cyber attack impacting students at dozens of the biggest universities and colleges in the U.S. and Canada.

Author: Winnti
Description: Researchers from ExaTrack discover Mélofée, a stealthy Linux implant allowing Chinese cyberespionage group Winnti to conduct targeted attacks.

Majestic Care files a notice of data breach after learning that hackers successfully launched a cyberattack, giving them access to confidential information belonging to current and former residents and staff members.
Central National Bank files a notice of data breach after learning that confidential client data entrusted to the bank was leaked following a cybersecurity event.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: Tecnosys Italia is hit with a LockBit 3.0 ransomware attack.

Author: North Korean state-backed hacking group? (Labyrinth Collima AKA Lazarus Group, Covellite, UNC4034, Zinc, Nickel Academy)
Description: A digitally signed and trojanized version of the 3CX Voice Over Internet Protocol (VOIP) desktop client compromised via exploitation of the CVE-2013-3900 vulnerability, is reportedly being used to target the company’s customers in an ongoing supply chain attack.
Researchers from Google's Threat Analysis Group (TAG) discover a new campaign targeting iOS and Android users to install commercial spyware and malicious apps.
Researchers from Google's Threat Analysis Group (TAG) discover a new campaign targeting Samsung Android users to install commercial spyware and malicious apps.

The SafeMoon token liquidity pool loses $8.9 million after an attacker exploited a newly created 'burn' smart contract function that artificially inflated the price, allowing the actors to sell SafeMoon at a much higher price.

Author: Money Message
Description: Researchers from Zscaler discover a new ransomware gang named 'Money Message', targeting victims worldwide and demanding million-dollar ransoms not to leak data and release a decryptor.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit ransomware group leaks data it stole from Washington County Sheriff’s Office in northeastern Florida.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Play
Description: The Play ransomware group claims to have hit BMW France, but in reality the victim turns out to be a local dealer.

Author: Mustang Panda (AKA Earth Preta, RedDelta, and TA416)
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro disclose the details of multiple campaigns launched by the Chinese threat actor Mustang Panda, targeting over 200 organizations worldwide.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit 3.0 ransomware gang claims to have breached the South Korean National Tax Service and threatens to leak the stolen data.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: NoName057(16)
Description: NoName057(16), an anti-Ukrainian hacktivist collective, takes down the website of the French National Assembly in retaliation for France’s support for Ukraine.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: NoName057(16)
Description: NoName057(16), an anti-Ukrainian hacktivist collective, takes down the website of the Children’s Parliament in retaliation for France’s support for Ukraine.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: OpcJacker
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover a new information-stealing malware called OpcJacker, targeting users in Iran via fake VPN malvertising.

Author: LummaC2
Description: Researchers from Ahnlab discover a new Infostealer called “LummaC2”, distributed disguised as illegal programs such as cracks and keygens.
The Newton Public Schools district cancels all classes after a computer network breach.
The hospitality giant in Australia, Meriton Suites, discloses that hackers had stolen nearly 36 gigabytes of data.

Author: Cyber Resistance
Description: A group of hackers claims to have broken into the email accounts of a Russian colonel, revealing personal information and military secrets.

Researchers from Sentinel One reveal the details of 'AlienFox', a new modular toolkit allowing threat actors to scan for misconfigured servers to steal authentication secrets and credentials for cloud-based email services.

Author: Moobot
Target: Vulnerable Cacti instances and RealTek devices
Description: Researchers from Fortinet discover a new variant of the Moobot botnet targeting vulnerable Cacti instances and RealTek devices via respectively CVE-2022-46169 and CVE-2021-35394 vulnerabilities.

Author: ShellBot
Description: Researchers from Fortinet discover a new variant of the ShellBot botnet targeting vulnerable Cacti instances via respectively CVE-2022-46169

Target: Users in France, Spain, Poland, the Czech Republic, Portugal, and other European countries
Description: Ukraine's cyber police arrests members of a fraud gang that stole roughly $4,300,000 from over a thousand victims across the EU.
Country: CZ ES FR PL PT EU

Author: Winter Vivern AKA TA473
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover a new campaign by the Russian hacking group tracked as TA473, aka 'Winter Vivern,' actively exploiting CVE-2022-27926 vulnerability in unpatched Zimbra endpoints to steal the emails of NATO officials, governments, military personnel, and diplomats.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: TMX Finance and its subsidiaries TitleMax, TitleBucks, and InstaLoan have collectively disclosed a data breach that exposed the personal data of 4,822,580 customers.

Researchers from Patchstack reveal that threat actors are actively exploiting a high-severity vulnerability in the popular Elementor Pro WordPress plugin, when using in conjunction with the WooCommerce plugin, used by over eleven million websites.

Author: TACTICAL#OCTOPUS
Description: Researchers from Securonix identify TACTICAL#OCTOPUS, an ongoing phishing campaign targeting individuals in the US using seemingly valid tax forms and contracts. Some of the lure documents observed contained employee W-2 tax documents, I-9, and real estate purchase contracts.

Author: RedGolf
Description: Researchers from Recorded Future identify a new campaign using a custom Windows and Linux backdoor KEYPLUG attributed to a threat activity group tracked as RedGolf, overlapped with APT41 and BARIUM, which is highly likely to be a Chinese state-sponsored group
Customers of the online second-hand fashion store Vinted report stolen funds and fraudulent activity on their accounts.

Unknown attackers post an advert on a Lithuanian IT community forum, claiming to have found an exploit to access user information on ticket-selling platforms in Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania owned by Piletilevi Group.

Author: Xloader
Description: Researchers from Zscaler identify a new variant of Xloader with several modifications including additional obfuscation.

The principal of Burns Science and Technology Charter, a Florida science and technology charter school has resigned after allegedly writing a $100,000 check to an Elon Musk impersonator using school funds.

Author: PayMe100USD
Description: Researchers from Fortinet discover PayMe100USD, a new ransomware variant written in Python.
Santa Clara Family Health Plan (SCFHP) files a notice of data breach after learning that confidential consumer information in the company’s possession was subject to unauthorized access.

Author: Vice Society
Description: Lewis & Clark College in Oregon is the victim of a ransomware attack by Vice Society.
Blauw, a dutch marketing firm suffers a data breach affecting 1.5 million individuals.
At least eight new healthcare providers reveal to have been involved in the breach of Adelanto HealthCare Ventures, a consulting firm supporting healthcare organizations.

Author: Cylance
Description: Researchers at Palo Alto Networks discover a new ransomware strain dubbed Cylance, targeting Linux and Windows devices.

Target: Our Lady of the Lake University (OLLU)
Description: Our Lady of the Lake University (OLLU) posts a notice of data breach on its website after the institution learned that an unauthorized party was able to access and remove files containing confidential student information from its computer system.

Southwest Healthcare Services files a notice of data breach after the organization learned that an unauthorized party was able to access confidential patient information stored on its computer system.

Author: Stormous
Target: Instituto De Educación Secundaria Ies Emilio Canalejo Olmeda (IESCO)
Description: The Instituto De Educación Secundaria Ies Emilio Canalejo Olmeda (IESCO) is hit by the pro-Russian Stormous ransomware group.
Researchers at CrowdStrike discover a campaign abusing WinRAR SFX archives

Author: Medusa
Description: The Chilean IT multinational SONDA, which has a presence in 11 countries, is placed on the leaks page of the ransomware threat actor Medusa Locker.
